Need help reading this?

createStorage

Utility to create a storage instance to interact with localStorage using encrypted (encoded) key/values.

createStorage
Parameters
config (Partial<T>)
useSessionStorage (boolean?)

get

Get all storage value (it uses localStorage.get()).

Unparseable values with JSON.parse() return their value as it is. On ssr or if the given key argument is not found defaultValue is returned, otherwise null.

get(key: TKey, defaultValue: (null | any)?): (any | null)
Parameters
key (TKey)
defaultValue ((null | any)?)
Returns
(any | null)

getAll

Get all storage values (it uses localStorage.get()).

undefined and null values are not returned.

getAll(defaultValues: Partial<T>?): T
Parameters
defaultValues (Partial<T>?)
Returns
T

set

Set a storage value (it uses localStorage.set()).

Non-string values are stringified with JSON.stringify()

set(key: TKey, value: any?)
Parameters
key (TKey)
value (any?)

setMany

Set all given storage values (it uses localStorage.set()).

Non-string values are stringified with JSON.stringify(), undefined and null values are removed from the storage

setMany(newValues: Partial<T>)
Parameters
newValues (Partial<T>)

has

Check if a storage value is truthy (it uses localStorage.get()).

has(key: TKey)
Parameters
key (TKey)

remove

Remove a storage value (it uses localStorage.remove()).

remove(key: TKey)
Parameters
key (TKey)

clear

Clear all storage values (it uses localStorage.remove()).

clear()

watch

Watch a storage value changes, this needs to be executed only in browser context (it uses window.addEventListener("storage")).

Inspiration from Multi Tab Logout in React — Redux

watch(keyToWatch: TKey, onRemoved: function (): void?, onAdded: function (): void?)
Parameters
keyToWatch (TKey)
onRemoved (function (): void?)
onAdded (function (): void?)

getZonedDate

It returns a Date object from a date string adjusted on the user timeZone, if a timeZone is not provided we try getting it from the Intl browwser native API. It gracefully falls back returning a non-timezone-based Date.

getZonedDate(dateString: any, timeZone: string?)
Parameters
dateString (any = "") A parseable date as string, Z is automatically suffixed if not present to correctly get time zone based time from a UTC date.
timeZone (string?) Optionally pass a timeZone (e.g. from user preference or from the server), it falls back trying to read it from the Intl browwser native API.

gtagPageview

gtagPageview
Parameters
args (...GtmPageviewArgs)

isIE

isIE(ssrValue: any)
Parameters
ssrValue (any = true)
Related
https://stackoverflow.com/a/21712356/12285349

isMobile

isMobile(ssrValue: any)
Parameters
ssrValue (any = true)
Related
https://stackoverflow.com/a/3540295

navigateToHash

It updates the browser's location hash by replacing the history state. The non-silent standard way would simply be location.hash = "#new-hash"

navigateToHash(hash: any)
Parameters
hash (any = "")

navigateToHashParams

It updates the location.hash with the given query params, it uses location.hash if a second argument hash is not provded

navigateToHashParams(params: (string | AnyQueryParams), hash: any)
Parameters
params ((string | AnyQueryParams) = {})
hash (any = "")

navigateToMergedHashParams

It updates the "query params" within the location.hash, it uses location

navigateToMergedHashParams(params: NonNullable<AnyQueryParams>, hash: any)
Parameters
params (NonNullable<AnyQueryParams> = {})
hash (any = "")

navigateToMergedParams

Merge current URL query parameters with the given ones, it uses history.

navigateToMergedParams(params: NonNullable<AnyQueryParams>, replace: boolean?)
Parameters
params (NonNullable<AnyQueryParams> = {})
replace (boolean?) Replace URL instead of pushing it in the history stack. By default it pushes it.

navigateToParams

Change current URL query parameters, it uses history.

navigateToParams(params: (string | AnyQueryParams), replace: boolean?): any
Parameters
params ((string | AnyQueryParams) = {})
replace (boolean?) Replace URL instead of pushing it in the history stack. By default it pushes it.
Returns
any: The query string with initial ?

navigateToUrl

It updates the browser's location URL with global history object

navigateToUrl(url: any, replace: boolean?)
Parameters
url (any = "")
replace (boolean?)

navigateWithoutUrlParam

Remove URL query parameter, it uses history

navigateWithoutUrlParam(paramName: string?, replace: boolean?)
Parameters
paramName (string?)
replace (boolean?) Replace URL instead of pushing it in the history stack. By default it pushes it.

redirectTo

Redirect to url with params {optionally}, removes eventual trailing question marks from the given URL, it uses location

redirectTo(url: string, params: AnyQueryParams?)
Parameters
url (string)
params (AnyQueryParams?)

storage

Storage, for localStorage and sessionStorage

storage

storageClient

Super minifiable local/session Storage client creator with SSR safety

storageClient
Parameters
useSessionStorage (boolean?)

gtag

List here the global variables used by third party scripts supported within the koine ecosystem. For instance Google Analytics globally available variables.

gtag

Type: function (...args: Array<any>): any
